sections.title: Headings
sections.description: Headings organize content by importance and structure. Use 1 to 6 `#` characters at the start of a line to create headings, with `#` representing the largest heading (H1) and `######` the smallest (H6). Proper use improves readability and SEO.

sections.title: Paragraphs
sections.syntax: Just write normally. Use a blank line between paragraphs.
sections.description: Paragraphs are created by simply writing text separated by one or more blank lines. Markdown automatically wraps text into paragraphs, making content flow naturally without extra tags.

sections.title: Line Breaks
sections.syntax:
End line with two spaces or use `
`.
sections.description:
Insert a line break without starting a new paragraph by ending a line with two or more spaces or by using the HTML `
` tag. This is useful for poems, addresses, or controlling spacing.

sections.title: Emphasis
sections.description: Use asterisks `*` or underscores `_` to italicize text, double them to bold, and tildes `~~` for strikethrough. Emphasis highlights important words or shows deleted text, improving content clarity.

sections.title: Blockquotes
sections.description: Blockquotes are used to indicate quoted text, notes, or citations. Start a line with `>` to create a blockquote. Nested blockquotes are possible by adding multiple `>`.

sections.title: Lists
sections.description: Lists organize information in ordered (numbered) or unordered (bulleted) formats. Use `-`, `*`, or `+` for bullets, and numbers followed by periods for ordered lists. Lists improve scannability.

sections.title: Task Lists
sections.description: Task lists add interactive checkboxes for to-dos or progress tracking, supported in GitHub Flavored Markdown. Use `[ ]` for unchecked and `[x]` for checked items.

sections.title: Code
sections.description: Inline code highlights small code snippets inside a sentence with backticks `` ` ``. For larger blocks, use triple backticks ``` to create fenced code blocks, optionally specifying a language for syntax highlighting.

sections.title: Links
sections.description: Links connect to other web pages or resources. Wrap the link text in square brackets `[]` followed by the URL in parentheses `()`. Links improve navigation and references.

sections.title: Reference-style Links
sections.description: Reference-style links separate the URL from the text to keep Markdown cleaner and easier to read. The reference is defined elsewhere, useful for reusing links.

sections.title: Images
sections.description: Images are embedded similarly to links but start with an exclamation mark `!`. Always include alt text for accessibility and SEO benefits.

sections.title: Tables
sections.description: Tables present structured data in rows and columns. Use pipes `|` to separate columns and dashes `-` to create headers. Alignment is customizable in some flavors.

sections.title: Horizontal Rule
sections.description: Horizontal rules create thematic breaks or section dividers. Use three or more hyphens `-` or asterisks `*` on a line by themselves.

sections.title: Escaping Characters
sections.description: To display Markdown special characters literally, escape them with a backslash `\`. Useful for showing code or examples that use Markdown syntax.

sections.title: HTML in Markdown
sections.description: Raw HTML tags can be embedded in Markdown to achieve effects not natively supported. Useful for custom styling, layout, or elements.

sections.title: Abbreviations
sections.description: Some Markdown processors support abbreviations that show a tooltip when hovered. Define abbreviations with this syntax to clarify terms.

sections.title: Footnotes
sections.syntax:
Text with footnote[^1]

[^1]: This is the note
sections.description: Footnotes let you add references or explanations without cluttering the main text. Supported in GitHub Flavored Markdown and other processors.

sections.title: Admonitions
sections.description: Special callout blocks for notes, warnings, tips, or important info. Popular in docs frameworks like Docusaurus.

sections.title: TOC (Table of Contents)
sections.description: Auto-generates a table of contents based on headings. Only supported by some Markdown processors.

sections.title: Highlight
sections.description: Marks text with a highlight style. Support varies between Markdown flavors.

sections.title: Custom ID for Headings
sections.description: Add custom IDs to headings for linking and navigation. Supported by some processors like Markdown-it and Docusaurus.

sections.title: Mermaid Diagrams
sections.description: Create flowcharts, sequence diagrams, and more with Mermaid syntax inside fenced code blocks.

sections.title: Math (LaTeX)
sections.description: Write mathematical expressions using LaTeX syntax, rendered by KaTeX or MathJax.

sections.title: Emoji
sections.description: Use colon syntax to insert emojis supported by platforms like GitHub, Discord, and Slack.

sections.title: Includes / Imports
sections.description: Some Markdown processors allow including content from other files to modularize documentation.
